intro: Forchhammeria polyandra, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves that are velvety to the touch, giving it its common name. The plant produces showy, yellow flowers that are clustered in terminal inflorescences. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. Forchhammeria polyandra is often found in wetlands and along riverbanks, where it thrives in moist, nutrient-rich soils.
